test_cases.name: E2E - Create Formula Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
preconditions: A valid, active user account with permissions to create metrics and edit dashboards.
The application environment at the specified base_url must be available and stable.
At least two pre-existing metrics with numeric data must be available in the system.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully logged in and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the correct company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The application dashboard is displayed.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Metrics Page by clicking 'Metrics' in the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form appears.

test_steps.action: Enter a unique metric name in the 'Name' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The Formula Builder interface is displayed.

test_steps.action: In the Formula Builder, search for and select the first metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click on the '+' operator button.
test_steps.expected_result: The '+' operator is added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the second metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is validated and accepted.

test_steps.action: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Resets On' dropdown appears.

test_steps.action: Select a day of the week from the 'Resets On' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected day is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: A confirmation message is displayed and the new metric appears in the metrics list.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens, showing available and selected metrics.

test_steps.action: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric is visible in the left panel.

test_steps.action: Click the metric in the left panel to move it to the right panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric moves from the left panel to the right panel.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes to show the newly added KPI card.

test_steps.action: Locate the correct metric card for the newly added metric on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card is visible in the 'My KPIs' section.

test_steps.action: Hover over the metric card.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button is revealed.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu with options like 'Edit' appears.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option in the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the Edit page for the metric.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Target' tab on the Edit page.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: Four input fields for custom target levels appear.

test_steps.action: Enter the Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 target values in their respective fields.
test_steps.expected_result: All four target values are entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved, and the user is redirected back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify the metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card now displays the custom target visual indicators.

test_steps.expected_result: Input fields for 'Start' and 'Target' values appear.

test_steps.expected_result: The target value is entered correctly.
